meanings.definition: To grade or evaluate incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: The teacher misgraded my test and gave me a lower score than I deserved.
meanings.sent2: I hope the machine doesn't misgrade the exams, or we'll have to recheck all the results.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to misgrade his friend's homework as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The weather can sometimes misgrade the quality of the crops, making it hard for farmers to sell them.
meanings.sent5: The misgraded report caused confusion among the team members, leading to delays in the project.

meanings.sent1: The misgraded paper had several errors that needed to be corrected.
meanings.sent2: She was upset when she received a misgraded certificate for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The misgraded painting looked like a masterpiece to the untrained eye.
meanings.sent4: The misgraded products were quickly returned by the customers for a refund.
meanings.sent5: The misgraded coins were worth more to collectors due to their rarity.
